explanation: Transmits a covert ICMP echo request with magic payload 'OPENRDP1' (base64-encoded). A listening implant could treat this as a signal to enable RDP or a hidden listener. Detection: inspect ICMP payload entropy/strings and frequency; IDS signatures for specific magic strings; baseline hosts rarely sending data-laden pings internally. No elevation required; UAC not triggered.
rationale_steps: Embed a recognizable trigger string in ICMP payload.
Send ping to signal a remote agent to enable a feature (e.g., open RDP).
Recommend ICMP payload content monitoring for detection.
